title: Abadía de Acón 2010 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of tree bark, cherry and cassis are rooty. This feels ripe, dense and generally well balanced. Rich flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, blackberry and black tea finish with creamy oak notes, herbal overtones and tobacco flavors. Drink through 2022.

title: Anton Bauer 2015 Gmörk Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: Notes of crisp green pear and crunchy red apple are very appetizing, the palate is fresh and echoes these flavors and edges them with some spice and alcoholic heat, but also has a drive and energy of its own. Friendly and very moreish.

title: Armstrong Family 2013 David's Folly Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Blending Cabernet with 33% Petit Verdot might seem like folly indeed but it works on this wine. The aromas of flowers, vanilla and spice are quite reticent while the dark fruit flavors pack a well-balanced punch, with firm tannins and spritely, mouthwatering acids capturing the attention.

title: Armstrong Family 2013 Four Birds Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Merlot makes up nearly two-thirds of this blend with the balance Cabernet Franc. Brooding dried herb, cocoa and dark fruit aromas lead to rich but well-balanced black-fruit flavors backed by a firm core of tannins.

title: Astrolabe 2014 Province Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine successfully blends several disparate notes into a harmonious whole. Hints of just-turned earth, cola, root vegetables, clove and fresh greens join on the nose, while the palate adds fruitier overtones of red cherries and berries. The tannins are silky, the acids vibrant.

title: Château Romanin 2012 Red (Les Baux de Provence)
description: This wine is soft and smooth, still young with a good tannic structure. It has a dusty texture, the tannins in suspension with the red and black berry fruits. It is rich and still developing. Like with all wines from Les Baux, the grapes are biodynamic. Drink from 2017.

title: DiStefano 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The variety is unmistakable, with aromas of toast, coffee, spice, fragrant herbs and black currant that announce themselves. The cherry flavors are elegant, tart and reserved with lightly chalky tannins backing them up.

title: Château de Berne 2015 Grande Récolte Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The dramatic buildings at Château de Berne are paralleled in the unusual square bottles they use for their wines. Rich and full of intense fruit, this cuvé is full bodied, with a rounded texture. A tangy, pepper background gives a bright, crisp aftertaste.

title: Black Stallion 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: An affordable appellation wine, there's an introductory whiff of meaty bacon that signals full-bodied goodness, followed by soft, integrated layers of cherry and vanilla. Thick and densely concentrated, it's drinking well now and should please many palates.

title: Steininger 2015 Riesling (Kamptal)
description: The nose gives little away but the palate reveals a juicy, straightlaced, citrus core of great freshness. As bracing as a palate cleanser and as refreshing as ocean spray. Needless to say this is ultraclean.

title: Recuerdo 2012 Gran Corte Red (Valle de Uco)
description: Blackberry and charred aromas announce a juicy, tight-framed palate with crispness and modest depth of fruit and texture. Oaky flavors of vanilla and chocolate accent snappy notes of red currant and plum. Raw tannins, citric acidity and related bite make the finish a bit fierce. Drink through 2021.

title: Nastl 2014 Klassik Cuveé Red (Niederösterreich)
description: What lovely, fresh notes of blueberry, red cherry and peppery spice. Indigenous Zweigelt is blended here with fleshier Merlot and the two make a very good go of it, adding pepper and cherry-ish verve to Merlot's plumminess. This is smooth, easy and fresh, a real all-rounder with a medium, supple body.

title: Netzl 2014 Carnuntum Cuveé Red (Carnuntum)
description: Blueberries and white pepper set the lovely, appetizing theme on this focused, medium-bodied but full-fruited wine. Red cherry, blueberry and red plum show a very pure presence and are supported by hints of cinnamon and vanilla. Focus is provided by freshness rather than tannin which is soft, pliable but present. All in all a very elegant, medium-bodied red.

title: JCK Wine Company 2014 Jack Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From winemaker John Kane, who worked for years with Kent Rosenblum, this wine is dense and decadently rich and concentrated, a jammy, thick flavor explosion of soy sauce, black olive and Dr. Pepper cola. Smooth on the palate, it threatens to overpower in ripeness before pulling back just enough to show complexity.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2014 Zweigelt (Thermenregion)
description: What a lovely and balanced rendition of Zweigelt: its forest fruit and cherry notes are pure and held in a tight focus on the midpalate. The body is smooth, full-fruited, generous but balanced by vibrant, food-friendly and appetizing freshness. Handled with such bravura, Zweigelt almost attains a Pinot-like elegance—no wonder, since the Reinisch-brothers are masters of their art.

title: Kenwood 2013 Six Ridges Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is not aromatic at first, blossoming slowly into shy layers of red berry and subtle cinnamon before taking on a pleasant juiciness and medium weight. The tannins are non-agressive and integrated into the spicy finish.

title: Kontos 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Cocoa, vanilla and baking spice aromas intertwine with cranberry, black licorice, herb and dark fruit on a wine with a very distinctive aromatic profile. The cranberry and cherry flavors are quite soft for the variety, seeming a touch dried out at times but showing a pleasing sense of balance.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)
description: This rich wine is ripe with red-berry fruits, mango and peach. Full in the mouth, it has a touch of spice from the Mourvèdre in the blend. Crisp and lively, the wine could age until 2018, although it will be best from late 2016.

title: Maddalena 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Stewed strawberries, blackberry jam, maple, brown sugar, black pepper, teriyaki and pork fat show on the lush nose of this bargain bottling. It's soft on the palate, with fruity strawberry and ripe plum flavors, as well as some more serious beef char elements. It's fun, easy and delicious.

title: Meinklang 2014 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)
description: Red cherry and wild strawberry suggest themselves aromatically. The light body is fresh and equally aromatic, slender, lithe and elegant. This is a very continental, balanced and rounded Pinot Noir, all the more charming for its unfussy, fresh-faced authenticity.

title: Loveblock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Struck flint and tomato stalk on the nose lead into a medium-bodied wine with strong citrus overtones. White grapefruit and green leafy notes linger on the dry finish.

title: Martin Ray 2014 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A showy but crisp and fresh style of Chard, this offers honey butter, ripe apple flesh, yellow roses, lemongrass and the slightest show of guava tropicality on the nose. The sip begins with that tropical guava and mango character, then tightens on mandarin orange and lemon rind.

title: Gnarly Head 2013 1924 Limited Edition Double Black Red (California)
description: This wine is dark in color, with just a thin red rim. It smells of ripe blackberries, grilled beef and clove, with flavors as dense as the color. For all its color and flavor intensity and fine-grained tannins, however, it feels smooth and velvety on the tongue and is hard to resist, especially at such a reasonable price.

title: Foxes Island 2009 Belsham Awatere Estate Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Now fully mature and showing some bricking at the rim, this is a savory, earthy example of Marlborough Pinot Noir. Roasted cauliflower and caramelized root veggies sound strange but are actually quite pleasant, while hints of dried fruit and molasses add the suggestion of fruit sweetness. Drink now.

title: Halter Ranch 2015 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Light and delicate bubblegum aromas are cut by pink lemonade, a touch of honeydew and a peachy ripeness on this blend of 67% Grenache, 22% Picpoul Blanc, 8% Mourvèdre and 3% Syrah. There is lots of minerality on the sip, with rainy slate and wet cement, as well as rounded watermelon, strawberry and bubblegum flavors, all sliced by lime and tangerine zest.

title: Harken 2014 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (California)
description: A tasty tang of toasted oak adds a great top note to this full-flavored and full-bodied wine, so that it seems to build complexity from the bass notes of ripe pear, to the butter and cinnamon in the middle and up to the wrapping of spicy, smoky oak.

title: Hearst Ranch 2013 Babicora Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Smashed berries, honeyed coffee, leather, beef jerky, cola and black pepper show on the nose of this complex wine by the legendary Hearst family. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, with lightly roasted coffee notes, touches of seared caramel, sesame oil and teriyaki and a base of dried black-plum fruit.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a concentrated, dark and brooding wine from the producer's well-known property, sparkling in acidity despite its intensity of weight and length. Blackberry and nutmeg sit atop a soft integration of tannin and oak. Drink now through 2020.

title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2015 Domaine des Diables Bonbon Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: The palest of rosés with just a hint of salmon pink, this perfumed wine bursts with crisp, refreshing red fruits. Raspberries dominate, with just a touch of zesty citrus to make the wine even fresher. The aftertaste shows a mineral texture.

title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2015 Heideboden Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)
description: An earthy, yeasty cloud precedes this crisp, textured white. The palate is urgent with freshness but not ready yet to show its full colors. This needs a little more time in bottle to become its rounded, refreshing self. The real action here is texture rather than aroma. Drink from late 2016.
